coredata.dc:title: The being in activity in leontiev's work and the social nature of psychism
coredata.prism:publicationName: Vygotsky and Leontiev: The Construction of a Marxist Psychology

abstract.ce:para: Leontiev's work was developed on the issues of Psychology's methodological crisis thatis presented by dualism in its investigations. The main goal of his work was to overcomethis dualism, which has an ideological function as it naturalizes problems of social origin.Thus, Leontiev proposed to study the being in activity, demonstrating the specificity ofhuman psychic activity in relation to animals. In this analysis, Leontiev shows how thematerial basis of human activity is social, and explains how in the course of the processof life reproduction through work, the human specific form of subjective reflection ofobjective reality becomes consciousness. Leontiev uses Marx to state that the actionoriented to an end is the unity to specific human activity, in a way that becomesinconceivable for the existence of an individual consciousness outside the social relationsof production of life.Thus, Leontiev presumes the inseparability between human activity and consciousness inscientific research, which definitely separates the notion of consciousness as a mereepiphenomenon, claiming it as an essential moment in activity. Therefore, as a way toreview object and method in Psychology, activity is central to Leontiev's work todemonstrate the social nature of psyche. 2015 Nova Science Publishers, Inc.

item-info.copyright: Copyright 2016 Elsevier B.V., All rights reserved.

citation-title.titletext: The being in activity in leontiev's work and the social nature of psychism

abstract.ce:para: Leontiev's work was developed on the issues of Psychology's methodological crisis thatis presented by dualism in its investigations. The main goal of his work was to overcomethis dualism, which has an ideological function as it naturalizes problems of social origin.Thus, Leontiev proposed to study the being in activity, demonstrating the specificity ofhuman psychic activity in relation to animals. In this analysis, Leontiev shows how thematerial basis of human activity is social, and explains how in the course of the processof life reproduction through work, the human specific form of subjective reflection ofobjective reality becomes consciousness. Leontiev uses Marx to state that the actionoriented to an end is the unity to specific human activity, in a way that becomesinconceivable for the existence of an individual consciousness outside the social relationsof production of life.Thus, Leontiev presumes the inseparability between human activity and consciousness inscientific research, which definitely separates the notion of consciousness as a mereepiphenomenon, claiming it as an essential moment in activity. Therefore, as a way toreview object and method in Psychology, activity is central to Leontiev's work todemonstrate the social nature of psyche. 2015 Nova Science Publishers, Inc.
